meanings.definition: The inner layer of cells in the gastrula that give rise to the lining of the digestive and respiratory tracts.
meanings.sent1: During development, endoblasts form the inner layer of cells in the gastrula.
meanings.sent2: The endoblasts will eventually become the lining of the digestive and respiratory tracts.
meanings.sent3: The endoblasts threw a party in the gastrula, celebrating their important role.
meanings.sent4: Like architects, endoblasts meticulously construct the lining of vital tracts.
meanings.sent5: In the gastrula, the endoblasts work tirelessly to shape the future of the organism.

meanings.definition: Cells that develop into the lining of the digestive and respiratory tracts in an embryo.
meanings.sent1: As the embryo grows, endoblasts specialize to form the lining of tracts.
meanings.sent2: Endoblasts play a crucial role in the development of the digestive and respiratory tracts.
meanings.sent3: The endoblasts in the embryo had a race to see who could line the tracts faster.
meanings.sent4: Endoblasts are like tiny builders shaping the future pathways of the embryo.
meanings.sent5: In the embryo, endoblasts transform into the essential linings of vital tracts.
